009package imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines;
010
011//import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Locale;
014
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016
017/**
018 * This class represents a straight line in Hessian normal form, i.e., 
019 * x * cos(angle) + y * sin(angle) = radius.
020 * It is a specialization (subclass) of {@link AlgebraicLine}.
021 * Instances are immutable.
022 * 
023 * TODO: This class is unfinished! Handling reference points to be added/completed!
024 */
025public class HessianLine extends AlgebraicLine {
026        
027        private final double angle;
028        private final double radius;
029        private final Pnt2d refPnt;     // reference point x_r, TODO: always zero!
030        
031        
032        // static factory methods ----------------------------------------
033        
034        public static HessianLine fromPoints(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
035                return new HessianLine(AlgebraicLine.fromPoints(p1, p2));
036        }
037        
038        // constructors --------------------------------------------------
039
040        public HessianLine(double angle, double radius) {
041                this(Math.cos(angle), Math.sin(angle), -radius);        // = a, b, c
042        }
043        
044        public HessianLine(double a, double b, double c) {
045                super(a, b, c); // creates a normalized line
046                this.angle = Math.atan2(this.getB(), this.getA());
047                this.radius = -this.getC(); // ... / Math.sqrt(sqr(this.a) + sqr(this.b));
048                this.refPnt = Pnt2d.from(0, 0);
049        }
050        
051        public HessianLine(AlgebraicLine L) {
052                this(L.getA(), L.getB(), L.getC());
053        }
054        
055        // getter methods ------------------------------------------
056        
057        public double getAngle() {
058                return angle;
059        }
060
061        public double getRadius() {
062                return radius;
063        }
064        
065        @Override
066        public double getXref() {
067                return refPnt.getX();
068        }
069        
070        @Override
071        public double getYref() {
072                return refPnt.getY();
073        }
074        
075        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
076        
077        @Override
078        public String toString() {
079                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f>",
080                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), angle, radius);
081        }
082
083}
